=> a

d) All of the above

b) Repair or reject defective units

d) All of the above

b) The specific standards the product or service must meet
c) The extent of QC actions
d) All of the above
=> d

=> d

a) Improve the production or service process
b) Repair or reject defective units
c) Devise a plan to improve the production or service process
d) All of the above
=> d

[9] What must the QC process ensure?
a) That specified requirements have been met
b) That poor service is repeated at no charge
c) That remedial efforts have produced satisfactory results
d) All of the above
=> d

[10] How does quality control (QC) differ from quality assurance (QA)?
a) QC refers to confirming specified requirements while QA refers to inspections
b) QC refers to implementing an effective QC program while QA refers to meeting the requirements of the client
